description:
Beautiful, buffed new trail with excellent signage, all compliments of the hard working crew at CMBA - Calgary Mountain Bike Alliance.
This newly constructed ribbon of singletracky goodness intersects good 'ole Tom Snow in 4 or 5 places but bypasses all the sucky parts of TS and cuts out a couple mindless grunts and replaces all of that with technical singletrack.
It ties into Moosepackers, Diamond T, Tom Snow and some other trails on the drafting board.  What makes a good ride is up Sulphur Springs to Pneuma, up Pneuma to Moosepackers, down Moosepackers to the top of Tom Snow/Ridgeback, Down Ridgeback to the cold ones in your cooler at Station Flats (24km & ~1000m cumulative climbing - you'll deserve the cold ones).
directions: Station Flats parking lot would be the usual choice, but you could also get to the top of it from West Bragg and up the gated road to Tom Snow.
title: Ridgeback (1..4)
